org.jpws.pwslib.persist
Interface ApplicationAdapter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFTPAdapter, DefaultFilesystemAdapter, DefaultUrlAdapter
public interface ApplicationAdapter

Interface for functions required from the context of a pluggable application. Presently the purpose of the interface consists in providing an IO-context for input and output streams for persistent files. Note that the syntax of file path specifications is open and solely dependent on the conventions posed by an implementing class.

The backend library implements a standard application adapter for the local file system (which is automatically loaded), namely DefaultFilesystemAdapter. The library always expects at least one adapter being loaded and can serve an unlimited number of user defined adapter implementations. Loading of adapters occurs through the static class Global.

Field Summary
static int DATABASE
          Adapter-type for any other application specific IO-context.
static int FILESYSTEM
          Adapter-type for a user addressable file system (e.g. the local file system).

          Adapter-type for an Internet based IO-context.

list

java.lang.String[] list(java.lang.String trunk,
                        java.lang.String trail,
                        boolean recurse)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Returns a list of full file paths from the directory system of this IO-context which all start with the text of trunk. trail is an optional additional selection criterion determining the file path ending. Directories are not included in the result list.

Parameters:
trunk - starting text of resulting file paths; if the path name of a directory is entered, it must end with a separator sign. (The behaviour if parameter is empty is context specific hence undefined)
trail - if not null ending text of resulting file paths
recurse - if true files of subdirectories are included
Returns:
String array of file paths in IO-context or null indicating this function is not supported
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Since:
2-1-0

renameFile

boolean renameFile(java.lang.String path,
                   java.lang.String newPath)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Attempts to rename or move a specified file in the context of the application. Note that moving of a file is not necessarily supported by an implementation or may be restricted as to valid destinations.

Parameters:
path - an existing file with write rights
newPath - the new name or location of the file
Returns:
true if an only if the operation was successful
Throws:
java.io.IOException

deleteFile

boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String path)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Attempts to delete a specified file in the context of the application.

Parameters:
path - an existing file with write rights
Returns:
true if an only if the file does not exist after termination of this method
Throws:
java.io.IOException

existsFile

boolean existsFile(java.lang.String path)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Determines whether there exists a specific file in the context of the application.

Parameters:
path - a file path
Returns:
true if and only if the given file exists
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                    throws java.io.IOException

unlockFileAccess

                      throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
path - String single file specification
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The application name as referred to in user interface. This must not be null or empty, otherwise the application will not get registered!

getType

int getType()
Returns the application type.

Returns:
one of FILESYSTEM, DATABASE or INTERNET

setModifiedTime

                        long time)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Attempts to set the "last modified" time marker for the parameter file on the external IO context.

Parameters:
path - file path
time - long Epoch time millis
Returns:
boolean true if and only if this operation was successful

java.io.IOException

getUrl

java.net.URL getUrl(java.lang.String filepath)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Returns an URL descriptor specifying a file in this application context identified by the parameter path string. It is assumed the naming is canonised. Adapters which cannot describe their files as URL may return null.

Returns:
URL file descriptor or null
Throws:
java.io.IOException
